poem:
### At the Gates of Learning

In the hallway of policies,  
they gather--a few voices,  
echoes against the walls  
of a quiet building.

Denied entrance, they turn  
with questions still unshelved,  
carrying the weight of books  
unread, spines unbroken,  
while decisions, like wayward  
balloons, drift into unknown air.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
